shorts.title: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.2M in health care costs
shorts.title_distilled: Lackawanna County contract with SEIU to save $1.
shorts.description: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content: The Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.2 million in health care costs
shorts.content_distilled: Lackawanna County Commissioners unanimously ratified a four-year contract Tuesday with the Service Employees International Union that will save the county $1.

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud
shorts.title_distilled: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud.
shorts.description: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.
shorts.content: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.

shorts.title: LOCAL COLLEGE: Elias’ shot helps lift Lackawanna men
shorts.title_distilled: LOCAL COLLEGE: Elias’ shot helps lift Lackawanna men.
shorts.description: Noah Elias’ 3-pointer with 85 seconds remaining put Lackawanna College ahead and the Falcons went on to defeat Thaddeus Stevens College of Technology, 81-76, in a nonregion men’s basketball game Tuesday at the Lackawanna College Student Union. Trailing, 73-72, Elias’ shot gave Lackawanna a 75-73 lead. Jaksa Pejovic followed with a basket to extend the lead to four. Thaddeus Stevens hit a 3-pointer, but two foul shots each by Jahsan Simms and Pejovic in the final 21 seconds sealed the win for the Falcons (9-7). Pejovic led five players in double figures with 19 points and also grabbed 11 rebounds. […]
shorts.content: Noah Elias’ 3-pointer with 85 seconds remaining put Lackawanna College ahead and the Falcons went on to defeat Thaddeus Stevens College of Technology, 81-76, in a nonregion men’s basketball game Tuesday at the Lackawanna College Student Union. Trailing, 73-72, Elias’ shot gave Lackawanna a 75-73 lead. Jaksa Pejovic followed with a basket to extend the lead to four. Thaddeus Stevens hit a 3-pointer, but two foul shots each by Jahsan Simms and Pejovic in the final 21 seconds sealed the win for the Falcons (9-7). Pejovic led five players in double figures with 19 points and also grabbed 11 rebounds. […]

shorts.title: HS ROUNDUP: Scranton Prep earns wins over Scranton in swimming
shorts.title_distilled: HS ROUNDUP: Scranton Prep earns wins over Scranton in swimming.
shorts.description: Sophia Galko, Rebecca Oakes, and Ella Schofield each won two individual events and were part of two winning relay teams to lead Scranton Prep to a 114-30 win over Scranton in a Lackawanna League girls swim meet on Tuesday. Anna Millett (100-yard butterfly) and Myla Kopa (100 breaststroke) each added a pair of individual wins for the undefeated Classics (4-0). 200 Medley Relay: Scranton Prep (Schofield, Kazuba, Galko, Kolosovsky) 2:02.20, SP; 200 Free: Rebecca Oakes (SP) 2:08.48, Kolosovsky (SP), Labar (SCR); 200 IM: Ella Schofield (SP) 2:24.20, Shursky (SP); 50 Free: Sophia Galko (SP) 26.53, Kaszuba (SP), Davalos (SP); 100 Fly: Anna Millett (SP) 1:10.41, Kopa […]
shorts.content: Sophia Galko, Rebecca Oakes, and Ella Schofield each won two individual events and were part of two winning relay teams to lead Scranton Prep to a 114-30 win over Scranton in a Lackawanna League girls swim meet on Tuesday. Anna Millett (100-yard butterfly) and Myla Kopa (100 breaststroke) each added a pair of individual wins for the undefeated Classics (4-0). 200 Medley Relay: Scranton Prep (Schofield, Kazuba, Galko, Kolosovsky) 2:02.20, SP; 200 Free: Rebecca Oakes (SP) 2:08.48, Kolosovsky (SP), Labar (SCR); 200 IM: Ella Schofield (SP) 2:24.20, Shursky (SP); 50 Free: Sophia Galko (SP) 26.53, Kaszuba (SP), Davalos (SP); 100 Fly: Anna Millett (SP) 1:10.41, Kopa […]
shorts.content_distilled: Sophia Galko, Rebecca Oakes, and Ella Schofield each won two individual events and were part of two winning relay teams to lead Scranton Prep to a 114-30 win over Scranton in a Lackawanna League girls swim meet on Tuesday.

shorts.title: HS BASKETBALL: Canavan scores 20 in Dunmore’s win over Holy Cross
shorts.title_distilled: HS BASKETBALL: Canavan scores 20 in Dunmore’s win over Holy Cross.
shorts.description: Brayden Canavan scored 20 points as second-ranked Dunmore earned its second win of the season over Holy Cross with a 56-49 triumph on Tuesday night in boys basketball. The Bucks improved to 12-1 overall and remained undefeated (5-0) and in first place in Division II. Nate Aviles scored 16 points and Carter Sload added 12 with three 3-pointers for Dunmore. Colin Farrell knocked down three 3-pointers and finished with 19 points and CJ Thompson had 14 points to pace Holy Cross (6-7, 2-3). Mid Valley 41, Honesdale 35: Landon Pratt scored five points in the third quarter when the Spartans took […]
shorts.content: Brayden Canavan scored 20 points as second-ranked Dunmore earned its second win of the season over Holy Cross with a 56-49 triumph on Tuesday night in boys basketball. The Bucks improved to 12-1 overall and remained undefeated (5-0) and in first place in Division II. Nate Aviles scored 16 points and Carter Sload added 12 with three 3-pointers for Dunmore. Colin Farrell knocked down three 3-pointers and finished with 19 points and CJ Thompson had 14 points to pace Holy Cross (6-7, 2-3). Mid Valley 41, Honesdale 35: Landon Pratt scored five points in the third quarter when the Spartans took […]
shorts.content_distilled: Brayden Canavan scored 20 points as second-ranked Dunmore earned its second win of the season over Holy Cross with a 56-49 triumph on Tuesday night in boys basketball.

shorts.title: BOYS BASKETBALL: Oh baby! Fourth-quarter run sends Riverside past Old Forge
shorts.title_distilled: BOYS BASKETBALL: Oh baby! Fourth-quarter run sends Riverside past Old Forge.
shorts.description: TAYLOR — Riverside gave their coach the perfect baby gift: A thrilling win against its rival. A fourth-quarter run helped rally the Vikings to a 68-61 victory over Old Forge in a Lackawanna League Division II boys basketball battle Tuesday night before a raucous capacity crowd at Riverside’s Patrick C. Revello Gymnasium. Nico Antoniacci led the way for Riverside (4-1 league, 12-1 overall), ranked third this week in the Times-Tribune Top 10 poll, with 40 points. Brayden Rose added 12 points, 11 rebounds and four assists. “I’m so proud of my team,” Antoniacci said. “All week at practice, coach talked […]
shorts.content: TAYLOR — Riverside gave their coach the perfect baby gift: A thrilling win against its rival. A fourth-quarter run helped rally the Vikings to a 68-61 victory over Old Forge in a Lackawanna League Division II boys basketball battle Tuesday night before a raucous capacity crowd at Riverside’s Patrick C. Revello Gymnasium. Nico Antoniacci led the way for Riverside (4-1 league, 12-1 overall), ranked third this week in the Times-Tribune Top 10 poll, with 40 points. Brayden Rose added 12 points, 11 rebounds and four assists. “I’m so proud of my team,” Antoniacci said. “All week at practice, coach talked […]

shorts.title: HS WRESTLING NOTEBOOK: Freshmen give Abington Heights boost
shorts.title_distilled: HS WRESTLING NOTEBOOK: Freshmen give Abington Heights boost.
shorts.description: Last Wednesday, Abington Heights’ Dakota Sandy stepped on the mat with his team trailing by nine points. The freshman needed just 1:53 to give the Comets momentum in their Lackawanna League Division I wrestling match Jan. 7 against West Scranton. He pinned Santino Aniska, a District 2 Class 3A champion last season, in the first period to cut the deficit to three. Abington Heights rolled from there, winning eight of the next 10 bouts to top the Invaders, 54-18. Sandy, Lucas Drake and Brady Full are three freshmen who have the Comets contending for a Division I title. “Our freshmen […]
shorts.content: Last Wednesday, Abington Heights’ Dakota Sandy stepped on the mat with his team trailing by nine points. The freshman needed just 1:53 to give the Comets momentum in their Lackawanna League Division I wrestling match Jan. 7 against West Scranton. He pinned Santino Aniska, a District 2 Class 3A champion last season, in the first period to cut the deficit to three. Abington Heights rolled from there, winning eight of the next 10 bouts to top the Invaders, 54-18. Sandy, Lucas Drake and Brady Full are three freshmen who have the Comets contending for a Division I title. “Our freshmen […]
shorts.content_distilled: Last Wednesday, Abington Heights’ Dakota Sandy stepped on the mat with his team trailing by nine points.

shorts.description: SCRANTON, LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — Police say a man is in custody and is facing several charges as authorities continue a death investigation in Scranton. The Scranton Police Department says on Friday, January 9, they, along with Dickson City and Throop Police Departments, took 19-year-old James "JB" Barbarino from Dickson City into custody. Police explain [...]

shorts.title: Firefighter shortage affecting departments across NEPA

shorts.description: KINGSTON, LUZERNE COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — There's a critical need for more firefighters, as departments face staffing shortages that directly impact the safety of our families and friends. 28/22 News Reporter Joe Mason has more on the push to fill these vacancies. The Kingston Forty Fort Fire Department is just one of many in NEPA experiencing [...]
